result.execSummary:
The defendant Quadren L Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concur to 17CF1958.  Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Concurrent with: 17CF1958

superMiscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $92 VW surcharge  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
Maintain full-time employment.  Obtain GED or high school diploma or equivalency.
Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified. DNA On file.   Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

*** IN CUSTODY ***

03:00 PM Defendant in court with Attorney Stephen Jay Eisenberg.  ADA Valerian Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of Guilty to count 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

On Motion of the State Dismiss the Repeater.

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #1 
Court sentences DE to:
-serve 6 years in WSP, bifurcated into:
-initial confinement: 3 years
-extended supervision: 3 years
-cc to 17CF1958

Challenge Incarceration Program: Eligible
Substance Abuse Program: Eligible

CONDITIONS
-Maintain full-time employment
-Obtain GED or high school diploma or equivalency
-Not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without valid prescription
-Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals
-DNA on file
-Any other conditions DOC may impose

COURT COSTS:
Ct #1
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due on ES

-Bond posted to be applied to fines and cc only and remainder returned to poster.

CREDIT
-Days credit for time served:  97 days
-Days credit to Prison: 97 days

-DE advised of post-conviction rights

Abby H./minutes emailed to DOC
